Section.Text: Every one who fraudulently

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: pretends to exercise or to use any kind of witchcraft, sorcery, enchantment or conjuration,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: undertakes, for a consideration, to tell fortunes, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: pretends from his skill in or knowledge of an occult or crafty science to discover where or in what manner anything that is supposed to have been stolen or lost may be found,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction.

Subsection.Text: Every one commits forgery who makes a false document, knowing it to be false, with intent

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that it should in any way be used or acted on as genuine, to the prejudice of any one whether within Canada or not; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that a person should be induced, by the belief that it is genuine, to do or to refrain from doing anything, whether within Canada or not.

Subsection.Text: Making a false document includes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: altering a genuine document in any material part;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: making a material addition to a genuine document or adding to it a false date, attestation, seal or other thing that is material; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: making a material alteration in a genuine document by erasure, obliteration, removal or in any other way.

Subsection.Text: Forgery is complete as soon as a document is made with the knowledge and intent referred to in subsection (1), notwithstanding that the person who makes it does not intend that any particular person should use or act on it as genuine or be induced, by the belief that it is genuine, to do or refrain from doing anything.

Forgery is complete notwithstanding that the false document is incomplete or does not purport to be a document that is binding in law, if it is such as to indicate that it was intended to be acted on as genuine.

No person commits forgery by reason only that the person, in good faith, makes a false document at the request of a police force, the Canadian Forces or a department or agency of the federal government or of a provincial government.

Section.Text: Every one who commits forgery

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction.

Section.MarginalNote: Use, trafficking or possession of forged document

Subsection.Text: Everyone commits an offence who, knowing or believing that a document is forged,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: uses, deals with or acts on it as if it were genuine;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: causes or attempts to cause any person to use, deal with or act on it as if it were genuine;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: transfers, sells or offers to sell it or makes it available, to any person, knowing that or being reckless as to whether an offence will be committed under paragraph (a) or (b); or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: possesses it with intent to commit an offence under any of paragraphs (a) to (c).

Subsection.Text: Everyone who commits an offence under subsection (1)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than 10 years; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of proceedings under this section, the place where a document was forged is not material.

Section.Text: Everyone is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than 14 years, or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction, who, without lawful authority or excuse, makes, repairs, buys, sells, exports from Canada, imports into Canada or possesses any instrument, device, apparatus, material or thing that they know has been used or know is adapted or intended for use by any person to commit forgery.

Section.MarginalNote: Public officers acting in the course of their duties or employment
Section.Text: No public officer, as defined in subsection 25.1(1), is guilty of an offence under any of sections 366 to 368.1 if the acts alleged to constitute the offence were committed by the public officer for the sole purpose of establishing or maintaining a covert identity for use in the course of the public officer’s duties or employment.

Section.MarginalNote: Exchequer bill paper, public seals, etc.
Section.Text: Everyone is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than 14 years who, without lawful authority or excuse,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: makes, uses or possesses

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any exchequer bill paper, revenue paper or paper that is used to make bank-notes, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any paper that is intended to resemble paper mentioned in subparagraph (i); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: makes, reproduces or uses a public seal of Canada or of a province, or the seal of a public body or authority in Canada or of a court of law.

Section.Text: Every one who knowingly

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: prints any proclamation, order, regulation or appointment, or notice thereof, and causes it falsely to purport to have been printed by the Queen’s Printer for Canada or the Queen’s Printer for a province, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: tenders in evidence a copy of any proclamation, order, regulation or appointment that falsely purports to have been printed by the Queen’s Printer for Canada or the Queen’s Printer for a province,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years.

Section.Text: Everyone who, with intent to defraud, causes a message to be sent as if it were sent under the authority of another person, knowing that it is not sent under that authority and with intent that it should be acted on as if it were, is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than five years.

Subsection.Text: Everyone commits an offence who, with intent to injure or alarm a person, conveys information that they know is false, or causes such information to be conveyed by letter or any means of telecommunication.
Everyone commits an offence who, with intent to alarm or annoy a person, makes an indecent communication to that person or to any other person by a means of telecommunication.

Everyone commits an offence who, without lawful excuse and with intent to harass a person, repeatedly communicates, or causes repeated communications to be made, with them by a means of telecommunication.
Everyone who commits an offence under this section is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than two years; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction.

Section.Text: Every one who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with intent to defraud and without lawful authority makes, executes, draws, signs, accepts or endorses a document in the name or on the account of another person by procuration or otherwise, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: makes use of or utters a document knowing that it has been made, executed, signed, accepted or endorsed with intent to defraud and without lawful authority, in the name or on the account of another person, by procuration or otherwise,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding fourteen years.

Section.MarginalNote: Obtaining, etc., by instrument based on forged document
Section.Text: Every one who demands, receives or obtains anything, or causes or procures anything to be delivered or paid to any person under, on or by virtue of any instrument issued under the authority of law, knowing that it is based on a forged document, is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding fourteen years.

Subsection.Text: Every one who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: fraudulently uses, mutilates, affixes, removes or counterfeits a stamp or part thereof,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: knowingly and without lawful excuse, the proof of which lies on him, has in his possession

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a counterfeit stamp or a stamp that has been fraudulently mutilated, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: anything bearing a stamp of which a part has been fraudulently erased, removed or concealed, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: without lawful excuse, the proof of which lies on him, makes or knowingly has in his possession a die or instrument that is capable of making the impression of a stamp or part thereof,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding fourteen years.

Subsection.Text: Every one who, without lawful authority,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: makes a mark,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sells, or exposes for sale, or has in his possession a counterfeit mark,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: affixes a mark to anything that is required by law to be marked, branded, sealed or wrapped other than the thing to which the mark was originally affixed or was intended to be affixed, or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: affixes a counterfeit mark to anything that is required by law to be marked, branded, sealed or wrapped,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding fourteen years.

Subsection.Text: In this section,

Definition.Text: mark means a mark, brand, seal, wrapper or design used by or on behalf of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the government of Canada or a province,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the government of a state other than Canada, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any department, board, commission or agent established by a government mentioned in paragraph (a) or (b) in connection with the service or business of that government;

Definition.Text: stamp means an impressed or adhesive stamp used for the purpose of revenue by the government of Canada or a province or by the government of a state other than Canada.

Subsection.Text: Every one who unlawfully

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: destroys, defaces or injures a register, or any part of a register, of births, baptisms, marriages, deaths or burials that is required or authorized by law to be kept in Canada, or a copy or any part of a copy of such a register that is required by law to be transmitted to a registrar or other officer,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: inserts or causes to be inserted in a register or copy referred to in paragraph (a) an entry, that he knows is false, of any matter relating to a birth, baptism, marriage, death or burial, or erases any material part from that register or copy,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: destroys, damages or obliterates an election document or causes an election document to be destroyed, damaged or obliterated, or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: makes or causes to be made an erasure, alteration or interlineation in or on an election document,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years.

Subsection.Text: In this section, election document means any document or writing issued under the authority of an Act of Parliament or the legislature of a province with respect to an election held pursuant to the authority of that Act.

Section.Text: Every one who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: being authorized or required by law to make or issue a certified copy of, extract from or certificate in respect of a register, record or document, knowingly makes or issues a false certified copy, extract or certificate,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not being authorized or required by law to make or issue a certified copy of, extract from or certificate in respect of a register, record or document, fraudulently makes or issues a copy, extract or certificate that purports to be certified as authorized or required by law, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: being authorized or required by law to make a certificate or declaration concerning any particular required for the purpose of making entries in a register, record or document, knowingly and falsely makes the certificate or declaration,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years.

Heading.Label: PART X
Heading.TitleText: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade

Section.Text: In this Part,

Definition.Text: goods means anything that is the subject of trade or commerce;

trading stamps includes any form of cash receipt, receipt, coupon, premium ticket or other device, designed or intended to be given to the purchaser of goods by the vendor thereof or on his behalf, and to represent a discount on the price of the goods or a premium to the purchaser thereof

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that may be redeemed

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: by any person other than the vendor, the person from whom the vendor purchased the goods or the manufacturer of the goods,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: by the vendor, the person from whom the vendor purchased the goods or the manufacturer of the goods in cash or in goods that are not his property in whole or in part, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: by the vendor elsewhere than in the premises where the goods are purchased, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that does not show on its face the place where it is delivered and the merchantable value thereof, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: that may not be redeemed on demand at any time,

ContinuedDefinition.Text: but an offer, endorsed by the manufacturer on a wrapper or container in which goods are sold, of a premium or reward for the return of that wrapper or container to the manufacturer is not a trading stamp.

Subsection.Text: Every one who, by deceit, falsehood or other fraudulent means, whether or not it is a false pretence within the meaning of this Act, defrauds the public or any person, whether ascertained or not, of any property, money or valuable security or any service,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to a term of imprisonment not exceeding fourteen years, where the subject-matter of the offence is a testamentary instrument or the value of the subject-matter of the offence exceeds five thousand dollars; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is guilty

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: of an indictable offence and is liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: of an offence punishable on summary conviction,

ContinuedParagraph.Text: where the value of the subject-matter of the offence does not exceed five thousand dollars.

Subsection.Text: When a person is prosecuted on indictment and convicted of one or more offences referred to in subsection (1), the court that imposes the sentence shall impose a minimum punishment of imprisonment for a term of two years if the total value of the subject-matter of the offences exceeds one million dollars.

Every one who, by deceit, falsehood or other fraudulent means, whether or not it is a false pretence within the meaning of this Act, with intent to defraud, affects the public market price of stocks, shares, merchandise or anything that is offered for sale to the public is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding fourteen years.

Without limiting the generality of section 718.2, where a court imposes a sentence for an offence referred to in section 380, 382, 382.1 or 400, it shall consider the following as aggravating circumstances:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the magnitude, complexity, duration or degree of planning of the fraud committed was significant;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the offence adversely affected, or had the potential to adversely affect, the stability of the Canadian economy or financial system or any financial market in Canada or investor confidence in such a financial market;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the offence involved a large number of victims;

Paragraph.Label: (c.1)
Paragraph.Text: the offence had a significant impact on the victims given their personal circumstances including their age, health and financial situation;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in committing the offence, the offender took advantage of the high regard in which the offender was held in the community;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the offender did not comply with a licensing requirement, or professional standard, that is normally applicable to the activity or conduct that forms the subject-matter of the offence; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the offender concealed or destroyed records related to the fraud or to the disbursement of the proceeds of the fraud.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Aggravating circumstance — value of the fraud
Subsection.Text: Without limiting the generality of section 718.2, when a court imposes a sentence for an offence referred to in section 382, 382.1 or 400, it shall also consider as an aggravating circumstance the fact that the value of the fraud committed exceeded one million dollars.

When a court imposes a sentence for an offence referred to in section 380, 382, 382.1 or 400, it shall not consider as mitigating circumstances the offender’s employment, employment skills or status or reputation in the community if those circumstances were relevant to, contributed to, or were used in the commission of the offence.
The court shall cause to be stated in the record the aggravating and mitigating circumstances it took into account when determining the sentence.

When an offender is convicted, or is discharged on the conditions prescribed in a probation order under section 730, of an offence referred to in subsection 380(1), the court that sentences or discharges the offender, in addition to any other punishment that may be imposed for that offence or any other condition prescribed in the order of discharge, may make, subject to the conditions or exemptions that the court directs, an order prohibiting the offender from seeking, obtaining or continuing any employment, or becoming or being a volunteer in any capacity, that involves having authority over the real property, money or valuable security of another person.
The prohibition may be for any period that the court considers appropriate, including any period to which the offender is sentenced to imprisonment.

A court that makes an order of prohibition or, if the court is for any reason unable to act, another court of equivalent jurisdiction in the same province, may, on application of the offender or the prosecutor, require the offender to appear before it at any time and, after hearing the parties, that court may vary the conditions prescribed in the order if, in the opinion of the court, the variation is desirable because of changed circumstances.
Every person who is bound by an order of prohibition and who does not comply with the order is guilty of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an indictable offence and is liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an offence punishable on summary conviction.

Section.Text: Every one who makes use of the mails for the purpose of transmitting or delivering letters or circulars concerning schemes devised or intended to deceive or defraud the public, or for the purpose of obtaining money under false pretences, is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years.

Section.MarginalNote: Fraudulent manipulation of stock exchange transactions
Section.Text: Every one who, through the facility of a stock exchange, curb market or other market, with intent to create a false or misleading appearance of active public trading in a security or with intent to create a false or misleading appearance with respect to the market price of a security,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: effects a transaction in the security that involves no change in the beneficial ownership thereof,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: enters an order for the purchase of the security, knowing that an order of substantially the same size at substantially the same time and at substantially the same price for the sale of the security has been or will be entered by or for the same or different persons, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: enters an order for the sale of the security, knowing that an order of substantially the same size at substantially the same time and at substantially the same price for the purchase of the security has been or will be entered by or for the same or different persons,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years.

Subsection.Text: A person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years who, directly or indirectly, buys or sells a security, knowingly using inside information that they

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: possess by virtue of being a shareholder of the issuer of that security;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: possess by virtue of, or obtained in the course of, their business or professional relationship with that issuer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: possess by virtue of, or obtained in the course of, a proposed takeover or reorganization of, or amalgamation, merger or similar business combination with, that issuer;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: possess by virtue of, or obtained in the course of, their employment, office, duties or occupation with that issuer or with a person referred to in paragraphs (a) to (c); or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: obtained from a person who possesses or obtained the information in a manner referred to in paragraphs (a) to (d).

Subsection.Text: Except when necessary in the course of business, a person who knowingly conveys inside information that they possess or obtained in a manner referred to in subsection (1) to another person, knowing that there is a risk that the person will use the information to buy or sell, directly or indirectly, a security to which the information relates, or that they may convey the information to another person who may buy or sell such a security, is guilty of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an offence punishable on summary conviction.

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty, an act is not an offence under this section if it is authorized or required, or is not prohibited, by any federal or provincial Act or regulation applicable to it.
In this section, inside information means information relating to or affecting the issuer of a security or a security that they have issued, or are about to issue, that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has not been generally disclosed; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: could reasonably be expected to significantly affect the market price or value of a security of the issuer.

Subsection.Text: Every one is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years who, with intent to make gain or profit by the rise or fall in price of the stock of an incorporated or unincorporated company or undertaking, whether in or outside Canada, or of any goods, wares or merchandise,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: makes or signs, or authorizes to be made or signed, any contract or agreement, oral or written, purporting to be for the purchase or sale of shares of stock or goods, wares or merchandise, without the bona fide intention of acquiring the shares, goods, wares or merchandise or of selling them, as the case may be, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: makes or signs, or authorizes to be made or signed, any contract or agreement, oral or written, purporting to be for the sale or purchase of shares of stock or goods, wares or merchandise in respect of which no delivery of the thing sold or purchased is made or received, and without the bona fide intention of making or receiving delivery thereof, as the case may be,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: but this section does not apply where a broker, on behalf of a purchaser, receives delivery, notwithstanding that the broker retains or pledges what is delivered as security for the advance of the purchase money or any part thereof.

Subsection.Text: Where, in proceedings under this section, it is established that the accused made or signed a contract or an agreement for the sale or purchase of shares of stock or goods, wares or merchandise, or acted, aided or abetted in the making or signing thereof, the burden of proof of a bona fide intention to acquire or to sell the shares, goods, wares or merchandise or to deliver or to receive delivery thereof, as the case may be, lies on the accused.

Section.MarginalNote: Broker reducing stock by selling for his own account
Section.Text: Every one is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years who, being an individual, or a member or an employee of a partnership, or a director, an officer or an employee of a corporation, where he or the partnership or corporation is employed as a broker by any customer to buy and carry on margin any shares of an incorporated or unincorporated company or undertaking, whether in or out of Canada, thereafter sells or causes to be sold shares of the company or undertaking for any account in which

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: he or his firm or a partner thereof, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the corporation or a director thereof,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: has a direct or indirect interest, if the effect of the sale is, otherwise than unintentionally, to reduce the amount of those shares in the hands of the broker or under his control in the ordinary course of business below the amount of those shares that the broker should be carrying for all customers.

Subsection.Text: Every one who, being a vendor or mortgagor of property or of a chose in action or being a solicitor for or agent of a vendor or mortgagor of property or a chose in action, is served with a written demand for an abstract of title by or on behalf of the purchaser or mortgagee before the completion of the purchase or mortgage, and who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with intent to defraud and for the purpose of inducing the purchaser or mortgagee to accept the title offered or produced to him, conceals from him any settlement, deed, will or other instrument material to the title, or any encumbrance on the title, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: falsifies any pedigree on which the title depends,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years.

Subsection.Text: No proceedings shall be instituted under this section without the consent of the Attorney General.

Section.Text: Every one who, as principal or agent, in a proceeding to register title to real property, or in a transaction relating to real property that is or is proposed to be registered, knowingly and with intent to deceive,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: makes a material false statement or representation,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: suppresses or conceals from a judge or registrar, or any person employed by or assisting the registrar, any material document, fact, matter or information, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is privy to anything mentioned in paragraph (a) or (b),

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years.

Section.Text: Every one who, knowing of an unregistered prior sale or of an existing unregistered grant, mortgage, hypothec, privilege or encumbrance of or on real property, fraudulently sells the property or any part thereof is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years.
Every one who wilfully

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with intent to mislead, injure or defraud any person, whether or not that person is known to him, gives to a person anything in writing that purports to be a receipt for or an acknowledgment of property that has been delivered to or received by him, before the property referred to in the purported receipt or acknowledgment has been delivered to or received by him, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: accepts, transmits or uses a purported receipt or acknowledgment to which paragraph (a) applies,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years.

Section.MarginalNote: Fraudulent disposal of goods on which money advanced

Subsection.Text: Every one who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: having shipped or delivered to the keeper of a warehouse or to a factor, an agent or a carrier anything on which the consignee thereof has advanced money or has given valuable security, thereafter, with intent to deceive, defraud or injure the consignee, disposes of it in a manner that is different from and inconsistent with any agreement that has been made in that behalf between him and the consignee, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: knowingly and wilfully aids or assists any person to make a disposition of anything to which paragraph (a) applies for the purpose of deceiving, defrauding or injuring the consignee,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years.

Subsection.Text: No person is guilty of an offence under this section where, before disposing of anything in a manner that is different from and inconsistent with any agreement that has been made in that behalf between him and the consignee, he pays or tenders to the consignee the full amount of money or valuable security that the consignee has advanced.

Section.Text: Every one is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: wilfully makes a false statement in any receipt, certificate or acknowledgment for anything that may be used for a purpose mentioned in the Bank Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: wilfully,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: after giving to another person,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: after a person employed by him has, to his knowledge, given to another person, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: after obtaining and endorsing or assigning to another person,

ContinuedParagraph.Text: any receipt, certificate or acknowledgment for anything that may be used for a purpose mentioned in the Bank Act, without the consent in writing of the holder or endorsee or the production and delivery of the receipt, certificate or acknowledgment, alienates or parts with, or does not deliver to the holder or owner the property mentioned in the receipt, certificate or acknowledgment.

Section.MarginalNote: Disposal of property to defraud creditors
Section.Text: Every one who,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with intent to defraud his creditors,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: makes or causes to be made any gift, conveyance, assignment, sale, transfer or delivery of his property, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: removes, conceals or disposes of any of his property, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with intent that any one should defraud his creditors, receives any property by means of or in relation to which an offence has been committed under paragraph (a),

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years.

Section.MarginalNote: Fraud in relation to fares, etc.

Subsection.Text: Every one whose duty it is to collect a fare, toll, ticket or admission who wilfully

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: fails to collect it,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: collects less than the proper amount payable in respect thereof, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: accepts any valuable consideration for failing to collect it or for collecting less than the proper amount payable in respect thereof,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years.

Subsection.Text: Every one who gives or offers to a person whose duty it is to collect a fare, toll, ticket or admission fee any valuable consideration

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for failing to collect it, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for collecting an amount less than the amount payable in respect thereof,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years.

Subsection.Text: Every one who, by any false pretence or fraud, unlawfully obtains transportation by land, water or air is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction.

Section.MarginalNote: Fraud in relation to valuable minerals

Subsection.Text: No person who is the holder of a lease or licence issued under an Act relating to the mining of valuable minerals, or by the owner of land that is supposed to contain valuable minerals, shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: by a fraudulent device or contrivance, defraud or attempt to defraud any person of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any valuable minerals obtained under or reserved by the lease or licence, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any money or valuable interest or thing payable in respect of valuable minerals obtained or rights reserved by the lease or licence; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: fraudulently conceal or make a false statement with respect to the amount of valuable minerals obtained under the lease or licence.

Subsection.Text: No person, other than the owner or the owner’s agent or someone otherwise acting under lawful authority, shall sell any valuable mineral that is unrefined, partly refined, uncut or otherwise unprocessed.

No person shall buy any valuable mineral that is unrefined, partly refined, uncut or otherwise unprocessed from anyone who the person has reason to believe is not the owner or the owner’s agent or someone otherwise acting under lawful authority.
In any proceeding in relation to subsection (2) or (3), in the absence of evidence raising a reasonable doubt to the contrary, it is presumed that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a sale, the seller is not the owner of the valuable mineral or the owner’s agent or someone otherwise acting under lawful authority; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a purchase, the purchaser, when buying the valuable mineral, had reason to believe that the seller was not the owner of the mineral or the owner’s agent or someone otherwise acting under lawful authority.

Subsection.Text: A person who contravenes subsection (1), (2) or (3) is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than five years.

If a person is convicted of an offence under this section, the court may order anything by means of or in relation to which the offence was committed, on such conviction, to be forfeited to Her Majesty.
Subsection (6) does not apply to real property other than real property built or significantly modified for the purpose of facilitating the commission of an offence under this section.

Section.MarginalNote: Possession of stolen or fraudulently obtained valuable minerals

Subsection.Text: No person shall possess any valuable mineral that is unrefined, partly refined, uncut or otherwise unprocessed that has been stolen or dealt with contrary to section 394.

Reasonable grounds to believe that the valuable mineral has been stolen or dealt with contrary to section 394 are, in the absence of evidence raising a reasonable doubt to the contrary, proof that the valuable mineral has been stolen or dealt with contrary to section 394.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than five years.

If a person is convicted of an offence under this section, the court may, on that conviction, order that anything by means of or in relation to which the offence was committed be forfeited to Her Majesty.
Subsection (4) does not apply to real property, other than real property built or significantly modified for the purpose of facilitating the commission of an offence under subsection (3).

If an information in writing is laid under oath before a justice by a peace officer or by a public officer who has been appointed or designated to administer or enforce a federal or provincial law and whose duties include the enforcement of this Act or any other Act of Parliament and the justice is satisfied that there are reasonable grounds to believe that, contrary to this Act or any other Act of Parliament, any valuable mineral is deposited in a place or held by a person, the justice may issue a warrant authorizing a peace officer or a public officer, if the public officer is named in it, to search any of the places or persons mentioned in the information.
Where, on search, anything mentioned in subsection (1) is found, it shall be seized and carried before the justice who shall order

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that it be detained for the purposes of an inquiry or a trial; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if it is not detained for the purposes of an inquiry or a trial,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: that it be restored to the owner, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: that it be forfeited to Her Majesty in right of the province in which the proceedings take place if the owner cannot be ascertained.

Subsection.Text: An appeal lies from an order made under paragraph (2)(b) in the manner in which an appeal lies in summary conviction proceedings under Part XXVII and the provisions of that Part relating to appeals apply to appeals under this subsection.
Every one who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: adds anything to or removes anything from any existing or prospective mine, mining claim or oil well with a fraudulent intent to affect the result of an assay, a test or a valuation that has been made or is to be made with respect to the mine, mining claim or oil well, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: adds anything to, removes anything from or tampers with a sample or material that has been taken or is being or is about to be taken from any existing or prospective mine, mining claim or oil well for the purpose of being assayed, tested or otherwise valued, with a fraudulent intent to affect the result of the assay, test or valuation,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of proceedings under subsection (1), evidence that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: something has been added to or removed from anything to which subsection (1) applies, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: anything to which subsection (1) applies has been tampered with,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is, in the absence of any evidence to the contrary, proof of a fraudulent intent to affect the result of an assay, a test or a valuation.

Subsection.Text: Every one who, with intent to defraud,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: destroys, mutilates, alters, falsifies or makes a false entry in, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: omits a material particular from, or alters a material particular in,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: a book, paper, writing, valuable security or document is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years.

Subsection.Text: Every one who, with intent to defraud his creditors, is privy to the commission of an offence under subsection (1) is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years.

Section.Text: Every one who, with intent to deceive, falsifies an employment record by any means, including the punching of a time clock, is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction.
Every one who, being entrusted with the receipt, custody or management of any part of the public revenues, knowingly furnishes a false statement or return of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any sum of money collected by him or entrusted to his care, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any balance of money in his hands or under his control,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years.

Subsection.Text: Every one who makes, circulates or publishes a prospectus, a statement or an account, whether written or oral, that he knows is false in a material particular, with intent

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to induce persons, whether ascertained or not, to become shareholders or partners in a company,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to deceive or defraud the members, shareholders or creditors, whether ascertained or not, of a company, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to induce any person to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: entrust or advance anything to a company, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: enter into any security for the benefit of a company,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years.

Subsection.Text: In this section, company means a syndicate, body corporate or company, whether existing or proposed to be created.

Every one who, by means of a false or misleading representation, knowingly obtains or attempts to obtain the carriage of anything by any person into a country, province, district or other place, whether or not within Canada, where the importation or transportation of it is, in the circumstances of the case, unlawful is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction.

Where a person is convicted of an offence under subsection (1), anything by means of or in relation to which the offence was committed, on such conviction, in addition to any punishment that is imposed, is forfeited to Her Majesty and shall be disposed of as the court may direct.
Every one who, being a trader or in business,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is indebted in an amount exceeding one thousand dollars,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is unable to pay his creditors in full, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has not kept books of account that, in the ordinary course of the trade or business in which he is engaged, are necessary to exhibit or explain his transactions,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years.

Subsection.Text: No person shall be convicted of an offence under this section

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: where, to the satisfaction of the court or judge, he

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: accounts for his losses, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: shows that his failure to keep books was not intended to defraud his creditors; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where his failure to keep books occurred at a time more than five years prior to the day on which he was unable to pay his creditors in full.

Section.Text: For the purposes of sections 402.2 and 403, identity information means any information — including biological or physiological information — of a type that is commonly used alone or in combination with other information to identify or purport to identify an individual, including a fingerprint, voice print, retina image, iris image, DNA profile, name, address, date of birth, written signature, electronic signature, digital signature, user name, credit card number, debit card number, financial institution account number, passport number, Social Insurance Number, health insurance number, driver’s licence number or password.

Subsection.Text: Everyone commits an offence who knowingly obtains or possesses another person’s identity information in circumstances giving rise to a reasonable inference that the information is intended to be used to commit an indictable offence that includes fraud, deceit or falsehood as an element of the offence.

Everyone commits an offence who transmits, makes available, distributes, sells or offers for sale another person’s identity information, or has it in their possession for any of those purposes, knowing that or being reckless as to whether the information will be used to commit an indictable offence that includes fraud, deceit or falsehood as an element of the offence.
For the purposes of subsections (1) and (2), an indictable offence referred to in either of those subsections includes an offence under any of the following sections:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: section 57 (forgery of or uttering forged passport);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: section 58 (fraudulent use of certificate of citizenship);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: section 130 (personating peace officer);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: section 131 (perjury);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: section 342 (theft, forgery, etc., of credit card);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: section 362 (false pretence or false statement);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: section 366 (forgery);

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: section 368 (use, trafficking or possession of forged document);

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: section 380 (fraud); and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: section 403 (identity fraud).

Subsection.Text: An accused who is charged with an offence under subsection (1) or (2) may be tried and punished by any court having jurisdiction to try that offence in the place where the offence is alleged to have been committed or in the place where the accused is found, is arrested or is in custody. However, no proceeding in respect of the offence shall be commenced in a province without the consent of the Attorney General of that province if the offence is alleged to have been committed outside that province.
Everyone who commits an offence under subsection (1) or (2)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than five years; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction.

Subsection.Text: Everyone commits an offence who fraudulently personates another person, living or dead,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with intent to gain advantage for themselves or another person;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with intent to obtain any property or an interest in any property;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: with intent to cause disadvantage to the person being personated or another person; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: with intent to avoid arrest or prosecution or to obstruct, pervert or defeat the course of justice.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (1), personating a person includes pretending to be the person or using the person’s identity information — whether by itself or in combination with identity information pertaining to any person — as if it pertains to the person using it.
Everyone who commits an offence under subsection (1)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than 10 years; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction.

Section.Text: Every one who falsely, with intent to gain advantage for himself or some other person, personates a candidate at a competitive or qualifying examination held under the authority of law or in connection with a university, college or school or who knowingly avails himself of the results of such personation is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction.

Every one who, without lawful authority or excuse, the proof of which lies on him, acknowledges, in the name of another person before a court or a judge or other person authorized to receive the acknowledgment, a recognizance of bail, a confession of judgment, a consent to judgment or a judgment, deed or other instrument is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years.

Heading.TitleText: Forgery of Trade-marks and Trade Descriptions

Section.Text: For the purposes of this Part, every one forges a trade-mark who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: without the consent of the proprietor of the trade-mark, makes or reproduces in any manner that trade-mark or a mark so nearly resembling it as to be calculated to deceive; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: falsifies, in any manner, a genuine trade-mark.

Section.Text: Every one commits an offence who, with intent to deceive or defraud the public or any person, whether ascertained or not, forges a trade-mark.
Every one commits an offence who, with intent to deceive or defraud the public or any person, whether ascertained or not,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: passes off other wares or services as and for those ordered or required; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: makes use, in association with wares or services, of any description that is false in a material respect regarding

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the kind, quality, quantity or composition,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the geographical origin, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the mode of the manufacture, production or performance

ContinuedParagraph.Text: of those wares or services.

Subsection.Text: Every one commits an offence who makes, has in his possession or disposes of a die, block, machine or other instrument designed or intended to be used in forging a trade-mark.
No person shall be convicted of an offence under this section where he proves that he acted in good faith in the ordinary course of his business or employment.

Section.MarginalNote: Other offences in relation to trade-marks
Section.Text: Every one commits an offence who, with intent to deceive or defraud,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: defaces, conceals or removes a trade-mark or the name of another person from anything without the consent of that other person; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: being a manufacturer, dealer, trader or bottler, fills any bottle or siphon that bears the trade-mark or name of another person, without the consent of that other person, with a beverage, milk, by-product of milk or other liquid commodity for the purpose of sale or traffic.

Section.Text: Every one commits an offence who sells, exposes or has in his possession for sale, or advertises for sale, goods that have been used, reconditioned or remade and that bear the trade-mark or the trade-name of another person, without making full disclosure that the goods have been reconditioned, rebuilt or remade for sale and that they are not then in the condition in which they were originally made or produced.

Subsection.Text: Every one who commits an offence under section 407, 408, 409, 410 or 411 is guilty of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an indictable offence and is liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an offence punishable on summary conviction.

Subsection.Text: Anything by means of or in relation to which a person commits an offence under section 407, 408, 409, 410 or 411 is, unless the court otherwise orders, forfeited on the conviction of that person for that offence.

Section.Text: Every one who falsely represents that goods are made by a person holding a royal warrant, or for the service of Her Majesty, a member of the Royal Family or a public department is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction.

Where, in proceedings under this Part, the alleged offence relates to imported goods, evidence that the goods were shipped to Canada from a place outside Canada is, in the absence of any evidence to the contrary, proof that the goods were made or produced in the country from which they were shipped.
Every one who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: secretes wreck, defaces or obliterates the marks on wreck or uses any means to disguise or conceal the fact that anything is wreck, or in any manner conceals the character of wreck, from a person who is entitled to inquire into the wreck,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: receives wreck, knowing that it is wreck, from a person other than the owner thereof or a receiver of wreck, and does not within forty-eight hours thereafter inform the receiver of wreck thereof,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: offers wreck for sale or otherwise deals with it, knowing that it is wreck, and not having a lawful authority to sell or deal with it,

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: keeps wreck in his possession knowing that it is wreck, without lawful authority to keep it, for any time longer than the time reasonably necessary to deliver it to the receiver of wreck, or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: boards, against the will of the master, a vessel that is wrecked, stranded or in distress unless he is a receiver of wreck or a person acting under orders of a receiver of wreck,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is guilty of

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: an indictable offence and is liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years, or

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: an offence punishable on summary conviction.

Section.Text: The Governor in Council may, by notice to be published in the Canada Gazette, prescribe distinguishing marks that are appropriated for use on public stores to denote the property of Her Majesty therein, whether the stores belong to Her Majesty in right of Canada or to Her Majesty in any other right.

Section.MarginalNote: Applying or removing marks without authority

Subsection.Text: Every one who,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: without lawful authority, the proof of which lies on him, applies a distinguishing mark to anything, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with intent to conceal the property of Her Majesty in public stores, removes, destroys or obliterates, in whole or in part, a distinguishing mark,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years.

Subsection.Text: Every one who, without lawful authority, the proof of which lies on him, receives, possesses, keeps, sells or delivers public stores that he knows bear a distinguishing mark is guilty of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an indictable offence and is liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an offence punishable on summary conviction.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section, distinguishing mark means a distinguishing mark that is appropriated for use on public stores pursuant to section 416.

Section.MarginalNote: Selling defective stores to Her Majesty

Subsection.Text: Every one who knowingly sells or delivers defective stores to Her Majesty or commits fraud in connection with the sale, lease or delivery of stores to Her Majesty or the manufacture of stores for Her Majesty is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding fourteen years.
Every one who, being a representative of an organization that commits, by fraud, an offence under subsection (1),

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: knowingly takes part in the fraud, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: knows or has reason to suspect that the fraud is being committed or has been or is about to be committed and does not inform the responsible government, or a department thereof, of Her Majesty,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding fourteen years.

Section.MarginalNote: Unlawful use of military uniforms or certificates
Section.Text: Every one who without lawful authority, the proof of which lies on him,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: wears a uniform of the Canadian Forces or any other naval, army or air force or a uniform that is so similar to the uniform of any of those forces that it is likely to be mistaken therefor,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: wears a distinctive mark relating to wounds received or service performed in war, or a military medal, ribbon, badge, chevron or any decoration or order that is awarded for war services, or any imitation thereof, or any mark or device or thing that is likely to be mistaken for any such mark, medal, ribbon, badge, chevron, decoration or order,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has in his possession a certificate of discharge, certificate of release, statement of service or identity card from the Canadian Forces or any other naval, army or air force that has not been issued to and does not belong to him, or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: has in his possession a commission or warrant or a certificate of discharge, certificate of release, statement of service or identity card, issued to an officer or a person in or who has been in the Canadian Forces or any other naval, army or air force, that contains any alteration that is not verified by the initials of the officer who issued it, or by the initials of an officer thereto lawfully authorized,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction.

Subsection.Text: Every one who buys, receives or detains from a member of the Canadian Forces or a deserter or an absentee without leave therefrom any military stores that are owned by Her Majesty or for which the member, deserter or absentee without leave is accountable to Her Majesty is guilty of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an indictable offence and is liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an offence punishable on summary conviction.

Subsection.Text: No person shall be convicted of an offence under this section where he establishes that he did not know and had no reason to suspect that the military stores in respect of which the offence was committed were owned by Her Majesty or were military stores for which the member, deserter or absentee without leave was accountable to Her Majesty.

In proceedings under sections 417 to 420, evidence that a person was at any time performing duties in the Canadian Forces is, in the absence of any evidence to the contrary, proof that his enrolment in the Canadian Forces prior to that time was regular.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Presumption when accused a dealer in stores
Subsection.Text: An accused who is charged with an offence under subsection 417(2) shall be presumed to have known that the stores in respect of which the offence is alleged to have been committed bore a distinguishing mark within the meaning of that subsection at the time the offence is alleged to have been committed if he was, at that time, in the service or employment of Her Majesty or was a dealer in marine stores or in old metals.

Heading.TitleText: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists

Subsection.Text: Every one who wilfully breaks a contract, knowing or having reasonable cause to believe that the probable consequences of doing so, whether alone or in combination with others, will be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to endanger human life,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to cause serious bodily injury,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to expose valuable property, real or personal, to destruction or serious injury,

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: to deprive the inhabitants of a city or place, or part thereof, wholly or to a great extent, of their supply of light, power, gas or water, or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: to delay or prevent the running of any locomotive engine, tender, freight or passenger train or car, on a railway that is a common carrier,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is guilty of

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: an indictable offence and is liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years, or

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: an offence punishable on summary conviction.

Subsection.Text: No person wilfully breaks a contract within the meaning of subsection (1) by reason only that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: being the employee of an employer, he stops work as a result of the failure of his employer and himself to agree on any matter relating to his employment, or,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: being a member of an organization of employees formed for the purpose of regulating relations between employers and employees, he stops work as a result of the failure of the employer and a bargaining agent acting on behalf of the organization to agree on any matter relating to the employment of members of the organization,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: if, before the stoppage of work occurs, all steps provided by law with respect to the settlement of industrial disputes are taken and any provision for the final settlement of differences, without stoppage of work, contained in or by law deemed to be contained in a collective agreement is complied with and effect given thereto.

Subsection.Text: No proceedings shall be instituted under this section without the consent of the Attorney General.

Every one is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than five years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who, wrongfully and without lawful authority, for the purpose of compelling another person to abstain from doing anything that he or she has a lawful right to do, or to do anything that he or she has a lawful right to abstain from doing,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: uses violence or threats of violence to that person or his or her spouse or common-law partner or children, or injures his or her property;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: intimidates or attempts to intimidate that person or a relative of that person by threats that, in Canada or elsewhere, violence or other injury will be done to or punishment inflicted on him or her or a relative of his or hers, or that the property of any of them will be damaged;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: persistently follows that person;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: hides any tools, clothes or other property owned or used by that person, or deprives him or her of them or hinders him or her in the use of them;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: with one or more other persons, follows that person, in a disorderly manner, on a highway;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: besets or watches the place where that person resides, works, carries on business or happens to be; or

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: blocks or obstructs a highway.

Subsection.Text: A person who attends at or near or approaches a dwelling-house or place, for the purpose only of obtaining or communicating information, does not watch or beset within the meaning of this section.

Section.MarginalNote: Intimidation of a justice system participant or a journalist

Subsection.Text: No person shall, without lawful authority, engage in any conduct with the intent to provoke a state of fear in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a group of persons or the general public in order to impede the administration of criminal justice;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a justice system participant in order to impede him or her in the performance of his or her duties; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a journalist in order to impede him or her in the transmission to the public of information in relation to a criminal organization.

Subsection.Text: Every person who contravenes this section is guilty of an indictable offence and is liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than fourteen years.

Section.Text: Every one who threatens to commit an offence under section 235, 236, 266, 267, 268, 269, 269.1, 271, 272, 273, 279 or 279.1 against an internationally protected person or who threatens to commit an offence under section 431 is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than five years.

Section.MarginalNote: Threat against United Nations or associated personnel
Section.Text: Every one who, with intent to compel any person, group of persons, state or any international or intergovernmental organization to do or refrain from doing any act, threatens to commit an offence under section 235, 236, 266, 267, 268, 269, 269.1, 271, 272, 273, 279 or 279.1 against a member of United Nations personnel or associated personnel or threatens to commit an offence under section 431.1 is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than ten years.
Every one who, being an employer or the agent of an employer, wrongfully and without lawful authority

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: refuses to employ or dismisses from his employment any person for the reason only that the person is a member of a lawful trade union or of a lawful association or combination of workmen or employees formed for the purpose of advancing, in a lawful manner, their interests and organized for their protection in the regulation of wages and conditions of work,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: seeks by intimidation, threat of loss of position or employment, or by causing actual loss of position or employment, or by threatening or imposing any pecuniary penalty, to compel workmen or employees to abstain from belonging to any trade union, association or combination to which they have a lawful right to belong, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: conspires, combines, agrees or arranges with any other employer or his agent to do anything mentioned in paragraph (a) or (b),

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction.

Subsection.Text: No employer or person acting on behalf of an employer or in a position of authority in respect of an employee of the employer shall take a disciplinary measure against, demote, terminate or otherwise adversely affect the employment of such an employee, or threaten to do so,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with the intent to compel the employee to abstain from providing information to a person whose duties include the enforcement of federal or provincial law, respecting an offence that the employee believes has been or is being committed contrary to this or any other federal or provincial Act or regulation by the employer or an officer or employee of the employer or, if the employer is a corporation, by one or more of its directors; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with the intent to retaliate against the employee because the employee has provided information referred to in paragraph (a) to a person whose duties include the enforcement of federal or provincial law.

Subsection.Text: Any one who contravenes subsection (1) is guilty of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an offence punishable on summary conviction.

Subsection.Text: Every one commits an offence who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: directly or indirectly, corruptly gives, offers or agrees to give or offer to an agent or to anyone for the benefit of the agent — or, being an agent, directly or indirectly, corruptly demands, accepts or offers or agrees to accept from any person, for themselves or another person — any reward, advantage or benefit of any kind as consideration for doing or not doing, or for having done or not done, any act relating to the affairs or business of the agent’s principal, or for showing or not showing favour or disfavour to any person with relation to the affairs or business of the agent’s principal; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with intent to deceive a principal, gives to an agent of that principal, or, being an agent, uses with intent to deceive his principal, a receipt, an account or other writing

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in which the principal has an interest,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: that contains any statement that is false or erroneous or defective in any material particular, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: that is intended to mislead the principal.

Subsection.Text: Every one commits an offence who is knowingly privy to the commission of an offence under subsection (1).
A person who commits an offence under this section is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years.
In this section, agent includes an employee, and principal includes an employer.

Every one who, by himself or his employee or agent, directly or indirectly issues, gives, sells or otherwise disposes of, or offers to issue, give, sell or otherwise dispose of trading stamps to a merchant or dealer in goods for use in his business is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction.

Every one who, being a merchant or dealer in goods, by himself or his employee or agent, directly or indirectly gives or in any way disposes of, or offers to give or in any way dispose of, trading stamps to a person who purchases goods from him is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction.

Heading.Label: PART XI
Heading.TitleText: Wilful and Forbidden Acts in Respect of Certain Property

Section.Text: In this Part, property means real or personal corporeal property.

Subsection.Text: Every one who causes the occurrence of an event by doing an act or by omitting to do an act that it is his duty to do, knowing that the act or omission will probably cause the occurrence of the event and being reckless whether the event occurs or not, shall be deemed, for the purposes of this Part, wilfully to have caused the occurrence of the event.
No person shall be convicted of an offence under sections 430 to 446 where he proves that he acted with legal justification or excuse and with colour of right.
Where it is an offence to destroy or to damage anything,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the fact that a person has a partial interest in what is destroyed or damaged does not prevent him from being guilty of the offence if he caused the destruction or damage; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the fact that a person has a total interest in what is destroyed or damaged does not prevent him from being guilty of the offence if he caused the destruction or damage with intent to defraud.

Subsection.Text: Every one commits mischief who wilfully

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: destroys or damages property;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: renders property dangerous, useless, inoperative or ineffective;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: obstructs, interrupts or interferes with the lawful use, enjoyment or operation of property; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: obstructs, interrupts or interferes with any person in the lawful use, enjoyment or operation of property.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Mischief in relation to computer data
Subsection.Text: Everyone commits mischief who wilfully

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: destroys or alters computer data;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: renders computer data meaningless, useless or ineffective;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: obstructs, interrupts or interferes with the lawful use of computer data; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: obstructs, interrupts or interferes with a person in the lawful use of computer data or denies access to computer data to a person who is entitled to access to it.

Subsection.Text: Every one who commits mischief that causes actual danger to life is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for life.
Every one who commits mischief in relation to property that is a testamentary instrument or the value of which exceeds five thousand dollars

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction.

Subsection.Text: Every one who commits mischief in relation to property, other than property described in subsection (3),

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction.

Subsection.Text: Every one who commits mischief in relation to property that is a building, structure or part thereof that is primarily used for religious worship, including a church, mosque, synagogue or temple, or an object associated with religious worship located in or on the grounds of such a building or structure, or a cemetery, if the commission of the mischief is motivated by bias, prejudice or hate based on religion, race, colour or national or ethnic origin,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding eighteen months.

Subsection.Text: Everyone who commits mischief in relation to property that is a building, structure or part thereof that primarily serves as a monument to honour persons who were killed or died as a consequence of a war, including a war memorial or cenotaph, or an object associated with honouring or remembering those persons that is located in or on the grounds of such a building or structure, or a cemetery is guilty of an indictable offence or an offence punishable on summary conviction and is liable,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: whether the offence is prosecuted by indictment or punishable on summary conviction, to the following minimum punishment, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for a first offence, to a fine of not less than $1,000,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for a second offence, to imprisonment for not less than 14 days, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: for each subsequent offence, to imprisonment for not less than 30 days;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the offence is prosecuted by indictment, to imprisonment for a term not exceeding 10 years; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the offence is punishable on summary conviction, to imprisonment for a term not exceeding 18 months.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Mischief in relation to cultural property
Subsection.Text: Every one who commits mischief in relation to cultural property as defined in Article 1 of the Convention for the Protection of Cultural Property in the Event of Armed Conflict, done at The Hague on May 14, 1954, as set out in the schedule to the Cultural Property Export and Import Act,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Mischief in relation to computer data
Subsection.Text: Everyone who commits mischief in relation to computer data

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction.

Subsection.Text: Everyone who wilfully does an act or wilfully omits to do an act that it is their duty to do, if that act or omission is likely to constitute mischief causing actual danger to life, or to constitute mischief in relation to property or computer data,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction.

Subsection.Text: No person commits mischief within the meaning of this section by reason only that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: he stops work as a result of the failure of his employer and himself to agree on any matter relating to his employment;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: he stops work as a result of the failure of his employer and a bargaining agent acting on his behalf to agree on any matter relating to his employment; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: he stops work as a result of his taking part in a combination of workmen or employees for their own reasonable protection as workmen or employees.

Subsection.Text: No person commits mischief within the meaning of this section by reason only that he attends at or near or approaches a dwelling-house or place for the purpose only of obtaining or communicating information.
In this section, computer data has the same meaning as in subsection 342.1(2).

Section.MarginalNote: Attack on premises, residence or transport of internationally protected person
Section.Text: Every one who commits a violent attack on the official premises, private accommodation or means of transport of an internationally protected person that is likely to endanger the life or liberty of such a person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than fourteen years.

Section.MarginalNote: Attack on premises, accommodation or transport of United Nations or associated personnel
Section.Text: Every one who commits a violent attack on the official premises, private accommodation or means of transport of a member of United Nations personnel or associated personnel that is likely to endanger the life or liberty of such a person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than fourteen years.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this section.

MarginalNote.DefinedTermFr: engin explosif ou autre engin meurtrier

Definition.Text: explosive or other lethal device means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an explosive or incendiary weapon or device that is designed to cause, or is capable of causing, death, serious bodily injury or substantial material damage; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
